location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 16/10 OPERATION OF AMERICAN SHIPPING COMPANIES IN THE PERSIAN GULF.'

physicalDescription.extent: The file consists of one piece of correspondence and a page with some file notes.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a note from the Political Resident, Persian Gulf, addressed to the Political Agent, Bahrain. It is dated aboard the scheme yacht, King Faisal, 4 December 1946, and is forwarding a note by Messrs Gray Mackenzie, Bahrain dated 17 August, 1946.The note records a conversation with a Mr Klein who mentioned that his company had purchased two 5000 ton freighters: one to transport locomotives from the United States of America to France and the other to carry drums of gasoline from Bahrain to Red Sea ports and further down the East African coast. Also discussed are the potential political difficulties of opening an office in Bahrain and how this could be circumvented.
